body_html:
I was profiling some of my own code in Pyro to detect a performance issue, and for a small example program I made to narrow things down it seems that log_prob is taking on average around twice as long on 1.0 compared to 0.4. This is a considerable slow down for me, since the log_prob method is one of the ones that is used the most during inference of my model.

Please, see the following gist for the small example: https://gist.github.com/ahmadsalim/5e98a01b5c2d77142e248ebf0fa36291 .

I have included the images showing the call time.

For 0.4.0:

For 1.0:

body:
I was profiling some of my own code in Pyro to detect a performance issue, and for a small example program I made to narrow things down it seems that `log_prob` is taking on average around twice as long on 1.0 compared to 0.4. This is a considerable slow down for me, since the `log_prob` method is one of the ones that is used the most during inference of my model.

Please, see the following gist for the small example: https://gist.github.com/ahmadsalim/5e98a01b5c2d77142e248ebf0fa36291 .

I have included the images showing the call time.

For 0.4.0:
![skaermbillede 2018-11-03 kl 18 37 14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1647846/48000246-e7b5b780-e0d2-11e8-9f23-11163e09938a.png)

For 1.0:
![skaermbillede 2018-11-03 kl 19 01 44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1647846/48000249-ea181180-e0d2-11e8-971a-bfbb966a427a.png)
